quiz.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of force?
Which force pulls objects toward the center of the Earth?
What can force do to an object?
A force of 10 N is applied to a box of mass 2 kg. What is its acceleration?
Which surface will produce the most friction?
A box with a weight of 50 N is dragged across a rough surface with a frictional force of 15 N. What is the net force acting on the box?
What force is responsible for keeping planets in orbit around the Sun?
An object is dropped from a height. If gravity is 9.8 m/s², what will be its velocity after 3 seconds?

quiz.topic: The Moon, the Sun, and the Tides
quiz.question: Which of these is responsible for ocean tides?

quiz.topic: The Moon, the Sun, and the Tides
quiz.question: A satellite orbits the Earth at a height where the gravitational field strength is 4 N/kg. If its mass is 500 kg, what is the gravitational force acting on it?
What type of eclipse occurs when the Moon blocks the Sun’s light?
An astronaut on the Moon jumps with a force of 300 N. If his mass is 60 kg, what is his acceleration due to gravity on the Moon? (Moon's gravity = 1.6 m/s²)
A car of mass 800 kg accelerates at 2 m/s². What is the force acting on it?
Which of the following forces is a contact force?
What is the weight of an object with mass 20 kg on Earth? (Take gravity as 9.8 m/s²)
A force of 30 N is applied to push a 10 kg object. What is the acceleration?
Which of the following reduces friction?
A car of mass 1000 kg is stopped by a frictional force of 5000 N. What is the deceleration?
What is the resultant force when two equal forces act in opposite directions?
A box is pushed with a force of 25 N to the right and 10 N to the left. What is the resultant force?
Two people push a car: one applies 50 N to the right, and the other applies 30 N to the right. What is the total resultant force?
